<description type="note">Title: The trial of Christ before Annas and Caiaphas.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of text unclear in the original and supplied by the current editor.</description>
[The Trial of Christ before Annas and Caiaphas]

here xal A massanger com in-to Ã¾e place rennyng and criyng Tydyngys tydyngys and so rownd Abowth Ã¾e place jhesus of nazareth is take Jhesus of nazareth is take and forth-with heylyng Ã¾e prynces Ã¾us seyng Massanger All heyle my lordys princys of prestys Sere cayphas and sere Annas lordys of Ã¾e lawe tydyngys I brynge ?ou reseyve Ã¾em in ?our brestys Jhesus of nazareth is take Ã¾er-of ?e may be fawe. he xal be browth hedyr to ?ou A-non I telle ?ou trewly with A gret rowth whan he was take I was hem Among and Ã¾er was I ner to kachyd a clowte. Malcus bar A lanterne and put hym in pres A-noon he had A towche and of went his ere Jhesus bad his dyscyple put up his swerd and ces And sett malcus ere Ageyn as hool as it was ere. So moty the methowut it was A strawnge syth Whan we cam fyrst to hym he cam vs A-geyn And haskyd whom we sowth Ã¾at tyme of nyth We seyd jhesus of nazareth we wolde haue hym fayn. And he seyd it is I Ã¾at am here in ?our syth With Ã¾at word we ovyr-throwyn bakward every-chon and some on here bakkys lyeng up-ryth but standyng up on fote manly Ã¾er was not on. Cryst stod on his fete As meke as A lom and we loyn stylle lyche ded men tyl he bad us ryse Whan we were up fast handys we leyd hym up-on but ?et me thought I was not plesyd with Ã¾e newe gyse. Ther-fore takyth now ?our cowncel and A-vyse ?ou ryth weyl And beth ryth ware Ã¾at he make ?ou not A-mat Ffor be my thryfte I dare sweryn at Ã¾is seyl ?e xal fynde hym A strawnge watt. here bryng Ã¾ei jhesus be-forn Annas and C. and on xal seyn Ã¾us Lo Lo Lordys here is Ã¾e man Ã¾at ?e sent us fore. Annas Ã¾erfore we cone ?ou thanke than and reward ?e xal haue Ã¾e more. Jhesus Ã¾ou Art welcome hedyr to oure presens ful oftyn-tymes we han Ã¾e besyly do sowth we payd to Ã¾i dyscyple for Ã¾e thretty pens and as an ox or an hors we trewly Ã¾e bowth. Ã¾er-fore now art oure as Ã¾ou standyst us be-fore Sey why Ã¾ou ast trobelyd us: and subuertyd oure lawe Ã¾ou hast ofte concludyd us and so Ã¾ou hast do more Where-fore it were ful nedful to bryng Ã¾e A dawe. Cayphas What arn Ã¾i dysciplys Ã¾at folwyn Ã¾e A-boute and what is Ã¾i dottryne Ã¾at Ã¾ou dost preche telle me now some-whath and bryng us out of doute Ã¾at we may to othere men Ã¾i prechyng forth teche. jhes[us] Al tymes Ã¾at I haue prechyd opyn it was don in Ã¾e synagog or in Ã¾e temple where Ã¾at all jewys com Aske hem what I haue seyd and Also what I haue don Ã¾ei con telle Ã¾e my wordys Aske hem everychon. ius judeus What Ã¾ou fela to whom spekyst Ã¾ou xalt Ã¾ou so speke to A buschop Ã¾ou xalt haue on Ã¾e cheke I make A vow and ?et Ã¾er-to A knok. here he xal smyte jhesus on Ã¾e cheke. jhesus yf I haue seyd Amys Ã¾er-of wytnesse Ã¾ou mayst bere and yf I haue seyd but weyl in Ã¾is Ã¾ou dost Amys me to dere. Annas Serys takyth hed now to Ã¾is man Ã¾at he dystroye not oure lawe and brynge ?e wytnesse A-?ens hym Ã¾at ?e can so Ã¾at he may be browt of dawe. ius doctor Sere Ã¾is I herd hym with his owyn mowth seyn brekyth down Ã¾is temple with-out delay and I xal settynt up Ageyn as hool as it was be Ã¾e thrydde day. ijus doctor ?a ser and I herd hym seyn Also Ã¾at he was Ã¾e sone of god and ?et many A fole wenyth so I durst leyn Ã¾er-on myn hod. iijus doctor ?a ?a and I herd hym preche meche Ã¾ing And A-?ens oure lawe every del Of wheche it were longe to make rekenyng to tellyn all at Ã¾is seel. Cayphas What seyst now jhesus whi Answeryst not heryst not what is seyd A-?ens Ã¾e Spek man spek spek Ã¾ou fop hast Ã¾ou scorn to speke to me Heryst not in how many thyngys Ã¾ei Ã¾e Acuse Now I charge Ã¾e and conjure be Ã¾e sonne and Ã¾e mone Ã¾at Ã¾ou telle us and Ã¾ou be goddys sone. Jhesus Goddys sone I am I sey not nay to Ã¾e And Ã¾at ?e all xal se At domys-day Whan Ã¾e sone xal come in gret powere and majeste And deme Ã¾e qweke and dede as I Ã¾e say. Cayphas A out out Allas what is Ã¾is heryth ?e not how he blasfemyth god what nedyth us to haue more wytness here ?e han herd All his owyn word Thynk ?e not he is worthy to dey. et clamabunt omnes ?ys ?ys ?ys All we seye he is worthy to dey ?a ?a ?a. Annas Takyth hym to ?ow and betyth hym som del ffor hese blasfemyng at Ã¾is sel. here Ã¾ei xal bete jhesus A-bout Ã¾e hed and Ã¾e body and spyttyn in his face and pullyn hym down and settyn hym on A stol and castyn A cloth ouyr his face and Ã¾e fyrst xal seyn ius judeus A felawys be ware what ?e do to Ã¾is man ffor he prophecye weyl kan. ijus judeus Ãat xal be A-sayd be Ã¾is batte what Ã¾ou jhesus ho ?aff Ã¾e Ã¾at. et percuciet super caput iijus judeus What whar now wole I Wetyn how he can prophecy ho was Ã¾at. iiijus judeus A and now wole I a newe game begynne Ã¾at we mon pley at all Ã¾at arn here-inne. whele and pylle whele and pylle comyth to halle ho so wylle ho was Ã¾at.
